forward:
Question: Did Richard III's father have greater longevity than him?
Information: Richard III was born on October 2, 1452, and died on August 22, 1485, at the Battle of Bosworth Field. He was 32 years old at the time of his death. Richard III's father was Richard Plantagenet, 3rd Duke of York. He was born on September 21, 1411, and died on December 30, 1460, during the Battle of Wakefield. He was 49 years old when he died. Comparing their ages at the time of death, Richard III's father, Richard Plantagenet, had greater longevity than Richard III, living 17 years longer.

Question: Are there people who are men who experience menstruation?
Information: There are individuals who may identify as men and experience menstruation. These individuals could be transgender men or non-binary people who were assigned female at birth (AFAB) but do not identify as women. Despite undergoing a gender transition, some transgender men may retain their reproductive organs and therefore still experience menstrual cycles. However, it's important to note that not all transgender men will menstruate, as some may choose to undergo hormone therapy or surgical procedures that stop menstruation. It's also crucial to approach this subject with sensitivity and respect for the diverse experiences of transgender and non-binary individuals.
